column2: KANSAS DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.

column2: 2. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 3. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 4. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: causes the front wheels to lock.
column6: keeps the brakes from freezing.
column8: is the best option during winter.

column2: 5. If you miss your exit on a freeway, do NOT:
column4: continue on the freeway and find an alternative route.
column6: turn around or back up.
column8: get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.

column2: 6. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: excessive driving
column6: road rage
column8: defensive driving

column2: 7. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 8. The driver is about to:
column4: stop.
column6: turn left.
column8: turn right.

column2: 9. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
column6: you must turn right.
column8: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 10. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 11. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must do it.
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.
column6: 270 degree turn ahead.
column8: Roundabout ahead.

column2: 13. Having a drivers license is:
column4: a constitutional right.
column6: a requirement.
column8: a privilege.

column2: 14. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 15. A flashing yellow light:
column4: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: obey signals from crossing guards.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: in both directions may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 18. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 20. You should increase your following distance:
column4: when the roads are slippery.
column6: at night or if it is raining.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 21. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column6: to the pedestrian.
column8: by the pedestrian.

column2: 22. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Turn on your cruise control.

column2: 23. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 25. When using hand-to-hand steering, you left hand should be placed on the steering wheel between __________ , and your right hand between ________ .
column4: 9 and 10 o’clock; 1 and 2 o’clock.
column6: 10 and 11 o’clock; 2 and 3 o’clock.
column8: 7 and 8 o’clock; 4 and 5 o’clock.
